commit.message: All result messages should throw an IllegalPayloadAccessException when the result is exceptional.

nodes.bodyText:
Just for my understanding here. This method is purely here to more easily test the GrpcBackedQueryUpdateMessageTest, right?
But, next to that it can be used by users to not return a normal update through the QueryUpdateEmitter, but actually to emit an exceptional update. Something which currently can only be achieved if thy use the GenericSubscriptionQueryUpdateMessage#asUpdateMessage(Object) method wherein they provide a ResultMessage implementation which itself is exceptional. Correct?
So, it's not purely the fix you're doing here, but providing a simplified form to emit exceptional updates. If I follow correctly that is.
